name: Remco Hotel Amsterdam City West

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Tulip Inn City West. It is a bit far out from the centre, about a 30 min tram ride, but this gave us the opportunity to see the sights of Amsterdam that we would have otherwise missed, also the tram ride is reasonable at a couple of euros and transport is very frequent. The hotel is very clean and tidy and the reception staff are helpful. We even received a complimentary upgrade on arrival to a superior room as we were celebrating our anniversary. As we stayed during an unusually hot period, the air conditioned room was appreciated. This is a pleasant reasonable hotel in a quiet location and the only negative comment I could make is that it is a bit of a distance from the town centre.
reviews.title: clean and tidy hotel
Out of the way
reviews.text: So far from the center of Amsterdam you might as well have stayed in Kiev. They don't tell you that when you register. It was a 30 minute tram ride--right past cool restaurants, beautiful canals, pretty architecture..............not one of which I could visit because the tram just kept on going until I got to this hotel. If you like "institutional" to describe your hotel then you will be pleased as punch at the Golden Tulip in West Amsterdam. On the way to scope out my room (past cinder block walls, YES, CINDER BLOCK WALLS, you read right--now sit back down) I conversed with the reception agent. She related that this place used to be a nursing home, which explains a lot. The actual interior of the rooms is ok and fairly clean (no safe which is weird for a 4-star). The food at the restaurant (a mint green-colored metal box that was probably constructed in the '70s--they do not tear anything down here) was mixed. Great Thai soup and apple strudel but the rest was just ok. The service is, well, European, and profoundly slow. If you tire of the smoke drifting in from the the "gerrymandered" smoking section that envelopes you you can just wheel yourself out to the patio and watch the birds until naptime. Oh, sorry--still can't shake that mental image...

reviews.title: Solid middleclass accomodation for good rates
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on a public holiday weekend because we didn’t want to pay the exaggerated prices in the city center. We found a bargain price on the internet. My total vote would be: nothing fancy, but a solid middleclass accomodation and I guess well above average compared to city center hotels in the same price range.

reviews.title: Very bad hotel
reviews.text: Location: A bit out of the way in a satellite city residential area (Osdorp). Easy to reach by car, plus they have an airport shuttle too. Free parking in front of the hotel (a big plus in Amsterdam too). It is an easy 10 min walk to the nearest tram station (Hoekenes), tram 17 takes you in 30 mins into the city (Dam, Main Station), the last tram runs past midnight. A 15-section strippenkaart can be bought for 6.70 Euro at the reception. You’ll need to validate 3 sections for a ride into the city, so it is good for 5 trips.

reviews.title: Great Room for the Price
reviews.text: Staff at the reception is friendly and helpful. Rooms are ready at 2 pm. We arrived at 1 pm, so they stored our luggage. Rooms are spacey and clean, typical middleclass hotel interieur, although no minibar. TV has international programs (CNN, BBC, German) as well.
We stayed at the Tulip Inn from the 24th to the 27th of December.
reviews.title: Great value, good hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: The area was good, about 10 min walk from the high street and a 15min tram journey from the city centre. You can take the train from Schipol aeroport and then the tram from lelylland (take the line AWAY from the City centre). Public transport in Amsterdam is really easy and the people are always happy to help. We were a bit concerned when we asked about the hotel in Schipol Information desk as the answer was "Wow, the tulip inn west!Ah..", but don't be phased!

The hotel is about a 10 walk from the tram stop on the local high street. When we were visiting all the shops were closed because of the Christmas holidays, but we could see that there was a lot of amenities there.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful (but a bit out of the way)
Great stay at Tulipn Inn Amsterdam West
reviews.text: The room was big for anyone's standards and clean. The bathroom was on the small side with a large shower, no bath.
The restaurant offered good priced meals and the bar is very good with good prices concidering it's a hotel. The staff are happy to help day or night.
reviews.title: Nice and Clean Rooms at Tulip Inn City West

reviews.text: The hotel is best described as "ok". Location wise, it's really not very good at all. You're only about a 10 minute walk to the nearest tram (Hoekenes) and these arrive pretty regularly - takes about 25 mins to get into town. However, the area around there is not good and walking to the hotel after the dark was pretty nerve-wracking!! No incidents, but not pleasant walking through blocks of high-rise flats.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually arrived quite late and our room had gone, but luckily for us we were given a suite. Great! Hold back with your expectations - the suite is on the top floor and simply is a larger room containing an additional double bed (looked like a couple of z-beds placed together). It was clean and tidy and had all the usual things you'd expect. In terms of a room, I couldn't complain and the bed was very comfy.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, excellent value

likes.liked: — Value for money, clean and large rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the airport shuttle to get back, however, when I checked, the woman had failed to tell the shuttle bus we needed to be picked up! I complained and we were given a taxi (which the hotel paid for) - still, very unimpressive service.
reviews.title: Average Airport Hotel

likes.liked: — Comfortable rooms with digital heat controls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I didn't have the breakfast so can't comment.
reviews.title: Not Happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, not a bad hotel - does the basics well, but use it as a bed for the night and nothing else. Don't pay a lot for it - we searched the internet and got it for about £35 a night - probably a good price for what we got, but not worth a great deal more. Does though provide a nice contrast to the over-priced city centre hotels.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for price.

description: Modern facilities and comforts; situated in a peaceful area in the western part of the city, 15 minute drive to city center.
